plea noun [C]
(STATEMENT)
law
  specialized the answer that a person gives in court when they have been accused of committing a crime: Mr Wilson entered a plea of not guilty.
More examplesFewer examplesThe prisoner entered a plea of not guilty.Her plea of ignorance of the law in extenuation of her crime was not accepted.The judge is not likely to look favourably on a plea of not guilty.His plea of guilty to manslaughter was not accepted by the prosecution.
